Reviews.Title: “It is what it is ... and it does it well”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: This is an airport hotel, nothing more, but nothing less. I found the room to be comfortable, clean and of ample size. It had a stand-up shower, and a smallish bathroom. However, the working space was nice, and I didn't have any issues with the internet speed. The elevator never took more than a minute, and the shuttle bus arrived within 15 (although they tell you 7 to 10). The breakfast was Hampton all the way, with biscuits and gravy, eggs, toast - the usual. The staff was pleasant enough, and the price right. My only issues: aircraft noise and lack of a guest laundry. The aircraft noise is hard to complain about at an airport hotel - so they get a pass on that one. The guest laundry would be most appreciated though. I'd go back.

Reviews.Title: “TRANSIT”
Reviews.Author: ALAN6821
Reviews.Content: Easy access from airport Staff Excellent Rooms comfortable All staff were willing to assist with any questions we had

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: stutheobald
Reviews.Content: Staying here on business it does what is needed, pretty functional and not too expensive. Where the hotel falls down is on the lack of speed on its internet connection and also on teh fact that this, and all the hotels on this area, are right under the flight paths of the jets meaning it can get noisy. Breakfast is changed every morning with two different hot dishes being put out for you to choose from alongside the regular stuff. Rooms are spacious and very clean

Reviews.Title: “For a Business hotel internet speeds might as well be dial up”
Reviews.Author: my50caliber
Reviews.Content: As a business man I live out of Hampton's. For the most part they are pretty nice but there is nothing more frustrating after a long day and you have to get on the internet to finish your job and you sit there waiting what seems like forever for a page to load. When a hotel asks well over a $100.00 a night the least you would expect is an internet speed that reflects the times. We left dial up 10 years ago, however this is one Hampton that still doesn't get it. For this I will have to down grade the review to a 2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Another good Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: Sassy131
Reviews.Content: We have recently decided to stay at Hampton Inns because we like their linens, the room layouts and the breakfast selections and flexibility. We had a very early flight and this hotel was convenient and affordable. We were a little concerned about previous reviews that mentioned airport noise, but we didn't hear any. I was expecting low-flying planes all night and it was very quiet. The front desk staff was great for our late checkin and breakfast had plenty of options for my breakfast-loving husband and for my lighter preferences. I highly recommend this Hampton if you need to stay near the airport. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: krzcoda13
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in, especially in light of the price. First the staff was very frustrating to deal with and often rude not only to myself but to others who were checking in at the same time I was. After waiting at leat 20 minutes, I was finally checked in by a very rude female attendent who practically threw my room keys at me. When I entered the roon, it smelled and didn't seem to be very clean. The bed was shoddily made and the carpet looked as if it hadn't been vacuumed in months. Last, it was hard to sleep in the room that night, not because of noise but because it felt as if I was being bitten by bugs in the bed although a hotel worker tried to assure me that I was mistaken. I don't know what a bed bug is but I am certainly wondering...next time I will be staying elsewhere. On top of all that, I was treated rudely when I checked out and because of this experience, I will be contacting Hilton Honors as I am a dimond memeber and should not be treated like this.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: azogal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and used the shuttle to and from the airport. When we called from the airport to be picked up, it took a long time for the shuttle to arrive. Every other hotel and parking shuttle drove by before the Hampton Inn. On our early morning return to the airport, we only had to wait a few minutes. The rooms were clean and we didn't notice any airplane noise. The rooms were decorated in the new Hampton style where the closet, desk, and window are along one wall. If someone is sitting at the desk, it is difficult to reach the closet. Also, the windows have shades instead of curtains so you have to choose privacy or having some light. The breakfast seemed skimpier than most other Hamptons.

Reviews.Title: “Small Rooms and Loud Planes”
Reviews.Author: TravelMel1
Reviews.Content: My husband I recently stayed at the Hampton Inn Seattle Airport. When we walked into the room, the first thing we noticed was how small it was. We booked a King Bed Study with pull-out sofa so this wasn't the smallest room they offered. I wouldn't have wanted to see a smaller one! The bathroom was tiny and didn't have a tub...just a walk-in shower. The front desk staff was not friendly nor helpful when we checked into the hotel. The rooms were clean. As others have mentioned...the planes are LOUD. They did have a very convenient airport shuttle available. I didn't use the shuttle but it was a very short drive to the airport...very convenient location. This hotel was not inexpensive and I definitely expected more. During our trip to the Seattle area, we also spent a night at the Homewood Suites Seattle Airport. What a difference between the two hotels! Yes the Homewood Suites was more expensive but a whole lot quieter, the staff was wonderful, hot breakfast and the rooms were much larger.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hampton property but avoid a late check in”
Reviews.Author: Lover_of_Oxford
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Seattle-Airport Hampton quite a few times over the past few years. Check-in after 11pm is ALWAYS a painfully slow process. The man who handles the front desk (Keith?) can't seem to locate a reservation, scan a credit card and get a key handed out in less than 5 minutes (or at least it seems that long). I have seen some improvement over the past 6 months or so but it is still slow. My last two stays I had no acknowledgement of my Diamond status, or welcomed back, or any of the "extras" such as bottled water and cookies. The service does not compare well with other Hilton properties I have stayed at. The property itself is a "standard" Hampton Inn: Clean, comfortable, predictable. The location is on the Airport side of the road and can be noisy if you are on the runway side of the building. The biggest issue is a late check in. Since I am usually just passing through, coming in at 10:30pm and leaving at 5:30 am, any delay has an impact. It will take the shuttle about 15 minutes to reach the airport although the trip to the hotel is just 5 minutes. When you add the length of time it takes to check in after 11pm, it can be 30-40 minutes from curb to bed. The Hilton and the Doubletree are closer and seem to have shuttles more regularly so you may want to check the pricing between the properties and choose accordingly. Both the Hilton and Doubletree have better properties and service but they can, at times, be much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good for overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: hicat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on arriving in Seattle and on leaving. The first time we had a nice quiet room although on the 4th floor which is e only smoking floor. Our room is non- smoking but the hallway reeked of smoke. The second time we stayed we were on the 3rd floor - no smoke smell - but very loud. We could hear the airplanes through the night. Room was clean and staff was friendly. Breakfast was decent but disappointing was the person preparing the food on our second visit. She was obviously sick - we saw and heard her coughing and sniffling. It didn't make for a pleasant meal, in fact we didn't eat all our food.

Reviews.Title: “Good option if you need to park a car”
Reviews.Author: Torquay102010
Reviews.Content: Only a little further out from "the strip" by Seattle airport is the Hampton Inn, Tukwila. We had a park and fly rate for $160 including leaving the car for 2 weeks. Usual good beds (after a long journey, much appreciated!), hot breakfast, shuttle to airport. Much quietet that right by the airport, although we did hear a little train noise.

Reviews.Title: “We couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: solomon5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our 6 am flight. It was a much more relaxing experience than we'd had at the nearby Doubletree the night we arrived, and it cost quite a bit less. At check in we were told the shuttle ran on demand 24/7. We were given several suggestions for dinner with information on how they might fit into our drive to return our rental car. We arranged for a 3 am wake up call and went to our room. The room was regular Hampton Inn but had a refrigerator and a wardrobe/desk rather than a closet. The bathroom was fine and there were plenty of towels. The directions to return the car were excellent and dinner was good, too. We called for a pick up and in less than 10 minutes our shuttle arrived and within a couple of minutes we were back at the hotel. There was little airport noise and we slept well. The wake up call was right on time and the shuttle and driver were waiting for us when we got downstairs. We will return here on our next visit whether we need to park a car or not. Parking is free.

Reviews.Title: “Airplanes everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: auditing4you
Reviews.Content: I know... It's an airport location which is the highlight! It is very close and that's a plus! Free shuttle around the hotel and to airport! Rooms are clean and do have the sound of airplanes! Overall I say try it if you fly in late or fly out early!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Recommendation for Seattle Airport”
Reviews.Author: grouper1948
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed at the Hampton Inn at Seattle airport for one night. Room was with a King size bed, which slept very comfortably. No external noises so a good night's sleep was accomplished. Breakfast food was about the same as other Hampton Inns and filled us up. Is a straight shot down International Blvd to the airport, about a five minute drive or so. If you need to stay at a hotel close to the airport, I would recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: jcminer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here coming and going, on our trip to Vancouver Island, BC. Great, friendly service including a free shuttle to airport and close by restaurants. Good Deluxe Breakfast was everything they said it would be. Rooms were clean and up to date. Bed was comfortable. Nice environment! Would recommend to friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and Staff! The shuttle service was Great!!”
Reviews.Author: mdgrif78
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn at the airport. Their Shuttle driver gave us some great locations for dinning and when we were ready to return he was there at the desinated time waiting on us. The breakfast was hot and very good! I would highly recommend this place if you are staying near the airport!!

Reviews.Title: “Too much Styrofoam”
Reviews.Author: SantaFeB
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn is pretty much my mid-price hotel/motel chain of choice when I'm on the road. The rooms are always lovely and well equipped, the Internet connections usually strong and always free (a huge plus since I travel a lot for business), the breakfast satisfying. But the Hampton Inn inevitably loses a star (for me, at least) due to the lack of glass drinking glasses. I am sure there are many corporate boilerplate reasons for substituting Styrofoam for glass, but none can convince me. Styrofoam cups cheapen the whole Hampton Inn experience...again, for me, at least. That said, the SEA-TAC property is terrific -- friendly service, convenient shuttle to and from the airport itself. The room was well-appointed, the bed comfortable and the front desk staff accommodating. OK, you can hear the jet engines of departing planes in the distance but it's more like "white noise," hardly objectionable. I liked the property a lot and highly recommend it if your travels require a night's sleep near the main Seattle airport. Now if they could just get rid of those Styrofoam cups...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a traveler”
Reviews.Author: Indy_Colts_Fan_44
Reviews.Content: My spouse & I stayed at this hotel for one night, wrapping up a very nice trip to the Vancouver area. As expected with Hampton Inn standards, this hotel met all of those expectations. Nice room, good breakfast. We were a bit surprised to see the bathroom had only a nice shower, no tub. The location is great, for those who are either arriving or departing from Seattle International Airport. The only drawback is that there really isn't much as far as good restaurants right around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: Wxtraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a 'classic' Hampton Inn. Nice but if you've stayed at others you know what you are expecting here. The bathroom was much smaller than others - almost too small. This hotel is about a 10 minute drive to Sea-Tac even though you can hear planes take off and land from the hotel. They do offer a free breakfast earlier and later than other hotels which is nice if you have an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and close to SEA, free breakfast and shuttle”
Reviews.Author: AustinWhitewater
Reviews.Content: I spent 1 night here in order to clean up from a hiking trip, repack for the trip home and make a very early flight the next morning. I generally like Hampton Inns and have stayed at lots of them around the US. This 1 was no exception. It is located about 6 blocks south of SEA on International Boulevard. They provided a free 24 hour airport shuttle service, which was important to me as I had no car. If you do have a car, parking is free. My short stay was in a King Bed Study with sofa. It was very roomy, clean, quiet and comfortable, and everything in the room looked to be in new condition. See their web site for a complete description of amenities. All 131 rooms in this hotel are nonsmoking. No pets are allowed. The complimentary cold and hot breakfast opens at 5 AM to accommodate guests on early flights. The hotel has no other food service but there are numerous restaurants within a few blocks, plus some that deliver. There is a computer with Internet connection in the lobby for guest use. The hotel has a pool and workout room, neither of which I used. All in all I was very satisfied with my stay here and recommend this Hampton Inn for a short or longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely quiet; clean; nice place.”
Reviews.Author: Mikel_49
Reviews.Content: This is our thrid stay at this property in the last two years. Each time we come to Seattle this is where we like to stay. Breakfast is included and is quite good though somewhat limited. It is good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: OutdoorBoomer
Reviews.Content: Friendly, comfortable, decent breakfast with early hours for travelers. They will make you a sack snack too. Shuttle service from airport - just pick up the phone in the courtesy van area to call. Also will drive you to some local restaurants. Reasonable price. I would definitely stay again going in or out of SEA-TAC. Nice little workout room...elliptical, treadmill, recumbent bike and medicine balls.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely top choice so far...”
Reviews.Author: Barneo
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in several hotels near the Seattle Airport, and this is our fav so far. Quick and friendly shuttle (even at midnight), quick check-in, and a really nice, clean, and comfortable room. Bed was heaven after six weeks of travel in Europe. Breakfast was the usual but good: croissant, yogurt, excellent mixed fruit, ham, and (probably once-frozen) scrambled eggs, decent coffee. It cost a bit more than the Holiday Inn Express, but it feels much nicer--beddding, decor, etc. Another big plus--VERY quiet. We chose 3rd floor (4th is smoking, 1st too near ground noise), turned on the room fan, and slept without interruption....aaaah.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Choice When Travelling thru SeaTac”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel009
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel 3 separate times during a recent vacation and found it meets all our needs. Reasonably priced for SeaTac. Clean. Compimentary full breakfast was way better than most. Staff was friendly. Shuttle to airport was timely. Just 50 yards from the Enterprise car rental drop-off. Only negatives were being on the south end of the airport runway, therefore some noise, and the elevator (only 1) is at the end of the hallway away from the desk.

Reviews.Title: “Very Close to Seattle Airport”
Reviews.Author: kjb176
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a five minute drive to Seattle airport. Overall the property is one of the better Hampton Inns. No charge for parking unlike the Holiday Inn down the street where I stayed the last time. Thought I would have a sleepless night from jet engine noises due to close proximity of hotel to airport, but that was not the case. I did however check-in late and depart early so perhaps the airport has landing/takeoff restrictions. Noticed hallway had smell of cigarette smoke but not in room. Breakfast starts at 5:00 a.m. and is included in rate, but hotel also close to a variety of restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: vbmegs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way back from Hawai'i. The hotel was clean, staff was excellent, especially our shuttle drivers - they will not only take you to and from the airport (and have quick service to and from), but also to surrounding local restaurants. The room was very trendy, clean and impressive. I always enjoy visiting Hampton Inns in different cities to see the little differences in each location. Great value for business or personal travel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to airport”
Reviews.Author: fsubonnie14
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight layover in Seattle and stayed at the Hampton Inn. The hotel was a standard Hampton Inn - exactly what we have come to expect and love. The airport shuttle was quick and exactly what we needed. If you're looking for a hotel near the airport, you can't go wrong with Hampton Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: worldisabook
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel since we had an early morning flight out of Sea-Tac. It is located in a quiet neighborhood with a park and lake across the street. There were plenty of parking spaces and its proximity to the airport is a great advantage. There were also a lot of restaurants nearby. The rooms were decorated nicely with dark woods. The beds were comfortable too. It was clean and the staff were friendly. Leaving during early breakfast hour was a madhouse and it looked like there were not enough seating areas for the number of people there. We opted for their paper bag options of breakfast to go so I can't comment on the food quality. We didn't hear any of the plane noises and had a very restful sleep. We're Hilton Honors members so we usually stay at a Hampton Inn and this was one of the better ones we have stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “We wish we could have stayed here longer.”
Reviews.Author: CandymanPF
Reviews.Content: Having just spent a few nights at The Courtyard By Marriott-Lynnwood (which was good) we were pleasantly surprised at how much more we enjoyed this hotel. We moved there for our last night to be near the airport for our morning flight. the service was above average, very friendly. Sometimes it is the little things that really make a big difference. In the early evening the front desk put out fresh baked cookies (three types) which were delicious. We liked the layout of our room better than at the Marriott, the bathroom had usable shelf space for example. They had a breakfast buffet which was kept well stocked at all times. They had a free shuttle which we took to the airport and the driver who was born in Romania could not have been nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Pediatri
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before our early morning flight for home. The hotel was up to the Hampton standards. Room was very attractive, comfortable, clean. Breakfast was good and well presented. A nice perk is that they begin serving at 5 am. No restaurants close by. Fast food (Taco Bell and Jack-in-the-box) was about 1/2 mile away. We ended up going to Ihop a mile down the road. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “one of the very good Hampton hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicoCT
Reviews.Content: it looks clean, the design is up to date, rooms are clean and very comfortable. Helpful service, at both the reception and the breakfast room. Breakfast tasted better than most Hampton I ve been to. Only critic would be about the noise of the planes, that is not totally filtered. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Policy made no sense!”
Reviews.Author: bossafin
Reviews.Content: I booked my last night in Seattle here to make the airport easy to get to for morning flight. Ended up needing a place the previous night also, so I went to book the room two nights in a row. I was told by the desk that the room I booked online was a handicapped accessible room (which I didn't request, it is simply what I was assigned by the website). I was told I couldn't book the same room for the first night, "in case a handicapped person came in". I asked why I could get it the second night..."Because the website booked it as the cheapest room"...okay, so just give me any room that I can have for two consecutive nights. No can do! I could have a smoking room the first night, then move to the handicapped room. I asked for a nonsmoking room and was told that would be $50 extra! It was stupid policy, and the guy at the desk really wouldn't stop explaining to me over and over again until his associate was rolling his eyes along with me! Ridiculous! Then when I got to the room, I checked the website I originally booked on and my room was available at the same rate for that night, even though the front desk gave me every reason why it wasn't. Too late. Slept in the stinky smoking room....

Reviews.Title: “Fine place to stay for an overnight before flying out of SeaTac”
Reviews.Author: JanetWP
Reviews.Content: Fine place to stay for an overnight before flying out of SeaTac

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable..”
Reviews.Author: Izzybeff
Reviews.Content: We got to Seattle a night earlier than we planned and our other hotel was booked for the night. Stayed here because we needed to be close to the airport. What a pleasant surprise. My Dh & I had been traveling for 10 days at that point and this was the nicest room we had stayed in yet. Would definitely stay again. Very close to the airport and we couldn't hear the planes at all.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for one-night stay before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: travel277
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before a cruise and it worked out nicely. The hotel's free shuttle picked us up at the airport, and it seems guests could make arrangements with the driver to pick them up at a nearby restaurant and drop them off at the hotel. Check-in was fast and easy. The room was adequate. Because of the location, we heard airplanes fly by many times and they were loud. We worked out at the fitness center, but it was small and had a treadmill and an elliptical machine. Breakfast was basic. The toaster and waffle maker are plugged into the same outlet, and the circuit breaker kept interrupting the toasting or waffle-making. The only signal that the appliances were ready was a lamp nearby would turn on when power came back. One thing we wish we had time to check out was a lake across the street. It looked like a nice place to walk to and hang out at if you don't have a car and want a nice peaceful morning.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet for being near the airport”
Reviews.Author: njgr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, a week apart from each other to bookend flying in and back out of the airport while we were visiting a nearby area. I was surprised at how quiet the hotel was for the proximity to the airport. It wasn't completely silent, of course, but the layout was specifically designed to reduce (not eliminate) airport traffic noise. Breakfast each morning was sufficient and good quality in comparison to other Hampton Inns we've stayed in (Hilton/Hampton is the chain we prefer when traveling) and was slightly different each morning, which was nice to see. The room decor was quite a bit nicer than Hampton Inns that I've normally stayed in, so that was a nice touch, and the hotel staff were more than helpful and pleasant when we needed assistance. (Both nights we stayed the manager on duty -- the same person both nights -- checked us in at night and out in the morning and assisted us with any issues that arose quickly and efficiently.) The location was great for getting to/from the airport, but there wasn't much choice of things to do or eat nearby, unfortunately. We'd definitely stay again for a quick night before or after needing to use the airport, but probably would not have an extended stay at this particular location, mainly due to distance from sights and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: happytravelpal
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, friendly staff, clean, comfortable and spacious rooms. Fine breakfast. Handy shuttle to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Place, Nice Staff, Charged me over $20 to send mouse back home”
Reviews.Author: ChevyGuy1234
Reviews.Content: I spent over $1300 staying at this hotel for nearly 2 weeks. I contacted them about it and they said they'd send it back. They requested my credit card information and I knew I was getting screwed then. I was charged $20 from Fedex through them to get my wireless mouse back. I could have bought 2 of them for that cost. I guess they won't be getting my business when I go back next time since they don't do favors for decent return business.

Reviews.Title: “The guest service is not #1 room smelled like smoke”
Reviews.Author: medsales75077
Reviews.Content: I travel on business and Vacation when I get the chance. I like the fact that I can review Hotels I stay at now I have found Tripadvisor. I love Hampton and Stay at them when I am on Business. This one has very bad Guest services and the breakfast was real nasty. I like the location and it has a free shuttle to the airport. BUT the lady at the front desk in the morning was weird and RUDE. I tried to get my bill for my stay for my company and it was like she was on the moon. More then 10 mins went by before she got to me as she was on her cell phone and talking to her self. The room the night before smelled like smoke and the room was not ready at 4pm. The hotel was not busy and I was told to just Waite in the lobby instead of giving me a cleaned room. Next time I will stay else where................

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, and efficient!”
Reviews.Author: ml80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just one night after checking out a few other hotel/motels on the International Blvd strip near the SeaTac airport Staff was pleasant, friendly and offered rides to the airport though we did not require one. Very clean, comfortable room with FREE WiFi internet. Also, free parking! There was a pool and workout room (did not use them) but those are nice amenities. Nice hotel, elevator was kind of in an odd place at the end of a long hallway but can't really complain. QUIET hotel, never heard a peep from another guest or the nearby airport. Couldn't tell we were near an airport! Beds were super comfy and loved the fluffy pillows. Front desk/lobby personnel were friendly and professional and stood up and thanked us for our stay when we departed and made sure everything was okay. I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfying stay in in a property with understated elegance”
Reviews.Author: BZT
Reviews.Content: I continue to be impressed with Hampton Inn's makeover, moving upscale and keeping their "entry level" Hilton tier hotel. There are high end features in this moderately priced hotel. Recent renovations, well appointed features such as upgraded bedding, stylish bathroom decor, a nicely appointed basic business work center, adjustable mood lighting. Though our double bed room was compact, it had excellent amenities and provided a great value. A small outdoor pool, kidney shaped on the west side is well situated to maximize the afternoon sun while the weather is warm enough to keep it open. Excellent breakfast buffet, simple, yet filling. Though bustling Seatac Airport is next door, we did not hear any undue noise from its operations.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice Near Airport”
Reviews.Author: Davidwatts
Reviews.Content: Standard-issue new Hampton Inn (this is a positive). Rooms are decent sized and everything worked and was clean. Has a small workout room and a small outdoor pool. Provides the usual Hampton Inn breakfast; lots of breads, cereals, fruit and a few hot items. In consideration of guests with early flights, the breakfast opens at 5:00 am daily. Not much around the hotel; this location is primarily to serve the airport, which is less than 10 minutes away. An airport shuttle is provided but I didn’t use it. The staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hampton Inn close to the Seattle Airport”
Reviews.Author: HOaKIE
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights while in Seattle on business. Picked it because it was close to SeaTac and my business colleagues and I were pleasantly surprised. The rooms were nice and comfortable. The airport was close by but I did not hear planes taking off or landing. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They have a shuttle to/from the airport which is very useful. Also will shuttle you to restaurants if you desire. The breakfast area was nice and the food was good. I would stay here again if I travel to Seattle on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: autiger3313
Reviews.Content: After a long night of driving back from Vancouver, I was tired and ready to go to sleep. I decided on the Hampton Inn by Sea-Tac, because I have three requirements when I pick a hotel: Cleanliness, Free Wifi, and Free Parking. This Hampton offers all of these things. I stayed on the fourth floor in a room that clearly was recently remodeled. This was a very very very nice room. I would rate it five star quality. Flat screen TV, Very comfortable bed, trendy bathroom and furniture. No complains what so ever about this hotel. I would suggest any traveler stay here, regardless of the purpose of your visit.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Cinnam0n
Reviews.Content: I always stay at a Hampton Inn when I travel for work, they are clean, the breakfast is a great convenience, and I love the free internet. I was wary of this hotel due to some of the reviews I have read, and was pleasantly surprised that this is one of the best that I have stayed at. The renovations seemed complete, my room was completely redone, a little small but nicely furnished and the bathroom was great. Staff great as usual and it was very quiet. The location is great for the airport, but food choices are few and far between. Would definitely stay here again if I need to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “No "10" Here”
Reviews.Author: Triplewin
Reviews.Content: Location is close to the airport. Seatac area is not the greatest. There are a few restaurants around (see my review of 13 coins). This property is at the tail end of a remodel. Upon arrival the entire lobby was torn apart and the front desk was relocated to a small desk by the front door. Needless to say check in was not as efficient as it should have been. Rooms have been totally remodeled. My room still had quite a punch list. The furniture was not completely assembled and already scuffed, wires protruding through a hole in the workstation, shower head was leaky…the bed was great and I appreciate the new layout of the workstation and the flat screen TV. The bathroom has a shower only but the water was hot and a few punch items remained in the bathroom. The first night there was some confusion at the front desk with room assignments where they gave a guest a key to my room twice…finally the front desk came up and was surprised to find me. Duh! Overall it was comfortable. New bed, linens and towels help. The location is near the airport so you can get some aircraft noise. I am sure it is no better at any of the other properties in the area. Once the remodel is finished I am sure your stay would be better.

Reviews.Title: “I think it was a fluke but,”
Reviews.Author: cleanfreak_8
Reviews.Content: Upon entry I saw the bathroom garbage full & a dirty towel thrown over the shower curtain. Then I noted spider webs and dust every where, no coffee for the coffee pot &, later, a huge puddle of water under the heater/ac...... the husband went out and informed the desk clerk of the water problem, resulting in the clerk saying he would be right in-- I finally went out to find the clerk to see where he was, after waiting for over an hour for him. The lady clerk said "oh, he went home, that is always wet and we don't know why it's wet". Then the icing on the cake ...no sheets on the bed!! I saw in the am that the window was leaking FYI. It was the last room, so we stayed---I do not think it is the norm for Hampton--but it was an interesting stay, to say the least!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hamption Inn I have stayed at”
Reviews.Author: fig_mar
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night at the inn prior to our flight out the next morning. This is the best Hampton Inn I have ever stayed out. The rooms were perfect. The breakfast in the morning was just great. Free wireless Internet to boot. There was free shuttle to and from the airport every 10-15 minutes. Give this hotel a chance.

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing was the housekeeper!”
Reviews.Author: dforce
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a convention and I got a Friends & Family rate at the Hampton Inn Seattle Airport. Generally speaking, if I ever travel on a discounted rate, I turn a blind eye to things that a full rate paying guest might be upset by. However, I just couldn't help to comment on my stay at this hotel. This has got to be the worst Hampton Inn I have ever stayed at. The facility itself is alright. The housekeeping staff are absolutely wonderful. The rooms are clean and the breakfast meets the Hampton Inn standard. The check-in was very disappointing, it took an extremely long time. The agent did not seem to know how to use the computer program and needed assistance from her co-worker. She was clearly getting frustrated at the computer and communicating with her co-worker in a manner that I would consider unprofessional in front of a guest. I was asked what floor I would like to be on so I selected the highest floor. However, she failed to advise me that there was construction on that floor and my room was about 1 of only 2 rooms on the floor occupied and that all around me would be construction. I had to climb over construction debris just to get to my room...literally....CLIMB! The worst part was that it was late afternoon and I had a dinner engagement so I wanted to nap so I could rest up. Unfortunately, it was next to impossible as the sound of table saws and other construction noise could be heard all around. At the end of the day, all of the debris was cleared out of the hallway but the construction started early again the next morning. Lucky for me, I had to be out of the hotel early. What disappointed me however is that despite the debris being cleared out of the hall, there was still saw dust and bits of dirt right in front of my door! Nobody made an effort to even vacuum the entrance ways of the rooms that were occupied. As a result, I ended up dragging in saw dust into my room! Upon check out, nobody asked how my stay was and what frustrated me even more is that the agent automatically put all of the charges straight onto my credit card without reviewing the bill with me or giving me a choice of how I would like to pay. Typically, I find Hampton Inns to be very good but I was very disappointed with this property. To make matters even worse, I wrote a complaint to the property via the Hampton website. I got the general response from Hampton Inn customer service that the comments had been sent to management but I never heard anything from management addressing the issues that I raised. I will certainly not be staying at this property again, not even for a discounted rate!

Reviews.Title: “Give it a pass until the fall”
Reviews.Author: hbyerly
Reviews.Content: This hotel was easily the worst Hampton Inn I've ever stayed at. The layout is odd (elevator is down a long hallway of rooms from the front desk), and the rooms are older and have pressboard furniture. There's no fridge or microwave. Major renovations to the property (everything except the beds)have just begun and are scheduled to go on through August. On a positive note, the staff are very nice, and the shuttle driver (Tim) was outstanding. There are no walkable restaurants in this "iffy" neighborhood, but Tim drove me to a nearby restaurant and waited for me to get take out to bring back to the hotel. I paid $130 at this hotel, and it was too much. Given that the staff seem great, it may be a good place once renovations are complete, but I'd give it a "miss" until then.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast a cut above”
Reviews.Author: Tommytag
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was much better than the typical "continental" at most chains. The breakfast room is set lower and away from the desk traffic and is pleasingly furnished with landscape views from the windows. There was a hotel employee continually cleaning and refilling the available items, and who also would discreetly handle obnoxious or unruly guests. They offered sausage, eggs, English muffins, biscuits, bagels, yogurt, cerealas, toaster waffles, fresh fruit, juices, and a choice of three coffee brews. Copies of USA Today are available for your morning read. The front desk was helpful, even though they were busy. They procured an inexpensive cab for us in under ten minutes and were prompt with their airport shuttle. The room was clean, well furnished, and the bed was extremely comfortable. I was concerned about the reviews regarding jet or traffic noise, but could not detect any such noise from my room. With the air conditioner running, I could not hear any outside noises. The price for all of this was less than you would pay for comparable chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “As usual, the best!!”
Reviews.Author: delmar60
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, well managed and has all a tired traveller wants. The rooms are huge, bed is to die for (love those Hampton beds) and they get breakfast out at 5.00AM!! The front staff got us a private car for 20.00 less than a taxi to get us to the train station!! Will stay again!! Thanks Willie!!

Reviews.Title: “Duck and Cover! Here comes another jet through the room!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ultimatetravelking
Reviews.Content: I had a jet fly through my room every 10 minutes. The loudest one was at 5:15 am. I gave up on sleeping then. They just kept coming. This is an older property. Probably early 1970's. The neighborhood must have been much nicer back then too. The location has gone down hill. The bed was extremely small, but reasonably comfortable. One roll over on either side and you would have fallen off. There were stains in the bathroom from the years of wear. Not dirty, just very old. A black streak here and black flecks there. The front desk was nice. Very close to the airport. The breakfast was okay. I did like being able to buy a Coke out of the machine for the bargain price of $.75 per 12 ounce can!

Reviews.Title: “Great Seattle Welcome at the Hampton Inn Sea-Tac”
Reviews.Author: TravelCubed_7
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton Sea-Tac for one night prior to an Alaskan cruise. This Hampton had probably the best and friendliest service of any hotel I've ever stayed at. The hotel is near the airport, obviously, and offers a free shuttle between it and the airport and restaurants and shopping near it. At the airport shuttle drop off/pick up area, I just had to use the free shuttle telephones and dial 46 (I think, or 43) to ring up the Hampton. They confirmed my reservation and sent out the shuttle. It arrived about 10 minutes later. The shuttle driver, Tim, was very friendly and had a fun personality. He also took us to a restaurant later and when we called, he picked us up within 10 minutes. We also used the shuttle the following morning to go back to the airport and then take the cruise transfers to the pier. The front desk was also very friendly and outgoing. Check in was quick and so was check out. The desk will give you a map showing nearby restaurants if you ask. You can also ask for a complementary bottled water. The hotel itself was clean and well kept. The amenities were standard Hampton. The complementary breakfast was also standard Hampton, though it lacked fruit unlike others. The food was kept up only by one elderly man who had a hard time keeping up. Overall, I recommend the hotel highly. I had read that the area was so-so and was a bit afraid to stay here after that but the area looked fine to me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice layover hotel”
Reviews.Author: minot_1997
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to rest at for a layover, not far from aiport. Had a nice pool to relax in. Had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for airport convenience”
Reviews.Author: Capital Culture
Reviews.Content: I arrived from the East Coast and was unable to continue my onward travel same day, so I stayed at this inexpensive airport location. It's so close that the airport shuttle arrives very quickly after contacting the hotel on the free phone. I was a little nervous when I saw that my room was next to the fitness center, but no one was being ambitious enough to exercise; so I had a quiet stay. If you simply need a place to sleep near the airport, this hotel is just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay/Value for an Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gg99
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise for a "night before travel" stay. The front desk was helpful, even though they were busy. The room was clean, spacious, and the beds were extremely comfortable. The continental breakfast was the best that I have ever had in a hotel. There was a kind person continually cleaning and refilling the available items. They had the fixing for a sausage and egg biscuit, as well as standard items like English muffins, bagels, yogurt and cereal. The coffee was surprisingly good (not even Starbucks!). The price for all of this was less than you would pay for a Marriott or Embassy, but honestly, those hotels have nothing on this Hampton. If all Hamptons were like this, Hilton would have a great alternative to their more expensive hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, we will return too”
Reviews.Author: glyster
Reviews.Content: TripAdvisor gives this hotel a 2 star, I'd say it's more like a solid 3 star hotel. We had a very pleasant experience. Yes, it was only a one night stay, there is really no reason to hang out around the airport for any more than that. The beds were heavenly. The rooms were spacious. Front desk staff very helpful. the morning breakfast was so-so, but to be expected. If you travel light, and you are willing to take the bus, the bus stop is across the street from the hotel and it'll take you to downtown for $1.25. Checkout the website for public transit in Seattle, there are more than one bus that will take you to downtown. The hotel offers free shuttle to/from airport 24 hours. Overall, the stay was definitely good value for our money. Also - free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: WaterEnthusiasts
Reviews.Content: No problems here. It's not a place that I'd want to book for more than a layover between flights out of SeaTac, but for that purpose it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “I will return”
Reviews.Author: miss_utility
Reviews.Content: Comfy pillowtop mattress and new bedding. Clean. Stayed 2 nights and no issues with airport noise even though next to SEA-TAC taxiways. My only complaint is the bath countertop is small and designed for very short people. Bonus is the window on 3rd floor opened for fresh air. Reliable Hilton high-speed internet. Neighborhood is a little dicey for solo female diner but a short drive to Redondo Beach for dinner at Salty's solved the problem. Front desk made reservation and provided driving directions. Redondo Beach beachside boardwalk is popular with walkers of all ages. Salty's also has an oudoor carry-out window for budget diners.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Slotmachinequeen
Reviews.Content: Interesting how people can have such different experiences. I stayed there last week prior to flying out and I thought the hotel was above average. No trouble at all with shuttle, the front desk staff was very accomodating in taking you to local restaurants. They even called restaurants for several folks and made reservations for them. Had problem with lobby computer in printing boarding pass, so desk clerk used the hotel computer to complete it for me. I didn't see any problems with security, although there must be some because back lot is closed in with barbed wire chain link fence. Seatac area is iffy, I wouldn't walk anywhere at any time of day. I would either stay at this Hampton or the Sleep Inn, which also has had problems with car breakins. Seems as if lesson is to leave nothing in car, which is what I do when in Seatac, I put everything in trunk.

Reviews.Title: “Fair room quality, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: 6Daysontheroad
Reviews.Content: Make sure your name is own the reservation, if you are traveling with a group or team. The motel WILL NOT send a shuttle to pick you up if your name is not listed. Also double check your room for any left behind items. I have been an Hilton Honors member for 10+ years and this was the first Hampton I asked for the 100% Guarantee. I did not get it. The guarantee is made by Hampton, but it is up to the individual motel whether they decide to honor it. Each Hampton is individually owned, so if you make complains through Hilton customer service they can only pass on the complaint they cannot do anything to take care of it. I am currently reviewing our corporate travel policy on hotels and will be downgrading Hampton to last resort. I am also deleting their bid for our corporate office stays in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: ponchodido
Reviews.Content: Beware if you leave your vehicle here. We took advantage of the park & ride and unfortunately our vehicle was broken into.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Affordable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: islandgirlcm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Seattle Airport on January 21, between returning from British Columbia and a flight out of Seatac the next morning. We had stayed at the hotel before and had a good experience. The hotel has ample free parking and the hotel lot feels safe although it is not gated. We parked very close to the front entrance of the hotel which may have contributed to our feeling of safety! Check in was a breeze. The clerk also offered a list of local dining locations and said that the on demand shuttle was available to take us anywhere on the list. Our room was spacious and clean, and so was the bathroom. the king sized bed was incredibly comfortable with very soft linens and good pillows. We noticed some TV noise from an adjacent room but it didn't disturb us. The hotel offers an outdoor pool, fitness center and continental breakfast. We didn't make use of any of these, but noticed that the breakfast included some hot items (sausage, eggs and biscuits on the day we were there) as well as the usual doughnuts, cereal, yogurt and toast. They also pack items into "breakfast to go" bags that you can grab on your way out. No idea what's in there, but seemed like a great idea for travellers! The on demand shuttle was great. We returned our rental car the night before our flight and the driver came and picked us up at the off-airport rental location within a few minutes of our call. We used the shuttle to get to the airport in the morning and it was prompt and efficient as well. You can't reserve the shuttle, you just go to the lobby about 10 or 15 minutes before you need a ride and it works pretty well. We had to wait 5-10 minutes for the van to return from a trip but since we had allowed for that we were not late. I would definitely recommend this hotel to other travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad property”
Reviews.Author: OP2002
Reviews.Content: Had been in Seattle for five nights and was flying out at 6am the following morning so opted for the Hampton Inn, partly thanks to frequent stays and benefits at Hilton properties. Cost was a reasonable $103 for the night. Arrived around 4pm and had a nice welcome pack of Oreos, bottles of water and note waiting for me which was decent. At check-in was given password for complimentary internet. Went to dinner with friends at a nearby place. Came back around 10pm and did some ironing before settling into bed. The room itself was a pretty decent size and bed was comfortable. Woke up around 4.15am and took a shower, the toiletries were standard HI affairs and not too bad. Shower was decent and even at 4.45am the breakfast buffet was out in the lobby. I was being fed on my flight so passed on it. The shuttle arrived after about 10mins and didn't wait around for others. Overall not a bad stay, not outstanding...needed more than 6hrs to scope the place out though.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohnThree
Reviews.Content: Close enough to Seattle for me to stay 5 nights. A 20 minute commute into the city, saving a lot of money. Total about $100 per night. Very quiet between rooms. Airport noise is there but not a problem even for a light sleeper. Great hot breakfast spread and snacks all day. Friendly and helpful staff and an army of housekeepers. Very nice room; looks like new; excellent bed. This is a $400 room in the city. Can't say enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaPixie
Reviews.Content: My husband and 6 month old baby girl stayed here July 14-16, 2006. We LOVED the room, very spacious and clean, and we really liked the all-white sheets and duvet cover. The bed and pillows were very comfortable, and the requested crib for our daughter was delivered immediately after check-in. The free breakfast was great and so nice to have after being on the road for a week and a half--it saved us a trip out to pick up breakfast. One nice plus is the beautiful park directly across the street from the Hampton Inn. On the night we arrived, we didn't feel like going out with the baby and wanted to stay close. We took a walk over to the park and there was "Shakespere in the Park" going on, with a huge crowd, and a beautiful lake just beyond. We said that each time we're in Seattle before flying out of SEATAC after visiting family in central WA, we're staying at this Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if leaving Seattle next day”
Reviews.Author: AJH
Reviews.Content: I've not stayed at a Hampton before this but I was very impressed. The beds were comfortable and the room was quiet. I heard just a faint bit of plane noise but nothing out of the ordinary if you live in a suburb of a big city! We all slept just fine. The breakfast was one of the nicer ones we had during our stay in the Seattle area which consisted of La Quinta's and Best Westerns. It had was a "glorified" continential breakfast and has something for everyone, truly. My hubby and kids used the pool and found it clean, warm and relaxing. We rented our car from Enterprise and it was just about 1 block away so quick access to drop off and back to airport if you catch an a.m. flight. We paid $119 on internet rate for family of 4. Can't beat the price/location if you need to fly the next day. I was impressed with Hampton, especially the beds and breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect much except for free shuttle”
Reviews.Author: jcniii
Reviews.Content: My tag line says it all...If you don't care listening to planes landing and taking off all night or a room without a true closet then this is your place. Free breakfast and shuttle and a nice staff do give this place some bonus points but other than that it is not up to Hampton Inn standards in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: YVRTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in November 2005. The hotel is located on the southern part of the Seattle airport strip. Under five minutes to the airport. Check-in was a bit on the slow side as the front desk staff seemed to be a bit overwhelmed having to deal with more than one person at a time. The signage in the lobby for the elevator was not the best. The rooms were clean and spacious; though the bed was not that comfortable as the mattress was very hard. Plenty of parking and coffee/tea available 24 hours in the lobby. Our early morning wake-up call (3:30am) was right on schedule and the front desk staff on duty at check-out was much more competent. Plus the Hampton Inn grab and go breakfasts were ready when we left the hotel just after 4am.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonaly Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fenwayman
Reviews.Content: Spent two single nights at this hotel (with a day between) so saw two different rooms. The first room was smaller than the second, which was impressively large (large enough to have two beds, and still let me do my exercises without moving them. The hotel was clean, and most of the staff were friendly. The shuttle service was very reliable and it is very close to the airport, and many nice restaurants. The rooms had too few electric outlets and I had to move furniture and unplug lamps to plug in my computer and cell phone at the same time. The rooms are not well soundproofed and I heard the airplanes at a volume that was worse than most airport hotels I've stayed at. Overall, it met my needs for a clean bed and an early (5 AM breakfast before a flight) and was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: Richbutnot
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night using Hilton Honors points before flying out the next morning. Only ten minutes from the airport which was nice for an early flight. They told us breakfast didn't start until 6 am, which was the same time our flight left, so we bought pastry to eat before we left for the airport. Walked through the lobby at 4:30 am and breakfast was out. Oh well. Room was small, but included fridge and microwave. Front desk was very helpful with maps of the area, but traffic was terrible. There are probably better airport hotels around there.

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn Seattle Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 19445 International Blvd., Seattle, WA 98188
